Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso respectively eighteen and nineteen lines of a continuous text describing the judicial proceeding before the local court of workmen of the necropolis, concerning the trial and condemnation of the workman Huy accused of stealing three spikes belonging to Pharaoh.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 14 and pl. XLVII, 1; S. Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no.218, pp.217-19; K.Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' IV (Oxford, 1982), 317-20. A.G.McDowell, 'Jurisdiction in the Workmen's Community of Deir el-Medina' (Leiden, 1990), p.157; 'idem', 'Village Life om Ancient Egypt' (Oxford, 1999), pp.188-90, no.145.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136403) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136403)
